results.t: BUSINESSWOMAN definition and meaning | Collins English ...

results.p: a woman who works in business, especially one who has a high position in a company: She's a good/shrewd businesswoman.
The meaning of BUSINESSWOMAN is a woman who transacts business; especially : one who is a business executive. How to use businesswoman in a sentence.
a woman regularly employed in business, especially a white-collar worker, executive, or owner.
1. a woman who works in business especially in a high position 2. a woman who is good at dealing with business and financial matters
A businessperson, also referred to as a businessman or businesswoman depending on the gender, is an individual who has founded, owns, or holds shares
Synonyms for BUSINESSWOMAN: businessman, entrepreneur, businessperson, seller, buyer, retailer, marketer, vendor, vender, enterpriser.
Aug 28, 2024 — someone who works in business, usually in a high position in a company. (Definition of businessman, businesswoman from the Cambridge Learner's Dictionary)
4 days ago — A businesswoman is a woman who works in business. They sell to a local businesswoman.
a female businessperson. see moresee less. types: brothel keeper, madam. a woman who runs a house of prostitution. type of: bourgeois, businessperson.
Women in business refers to female businesspeople who hold positions, particularly leadership in the fields of commerce, business, and entrepreneurship.
